logging_utils¶

Classes¶

Logger

def makeRecord()

def timeit()
NoParsingFilter

def __init__()

def filter()

Description¶

General purpose logging objects.

logging.Logger¶

Responsible for creating and processing log records. Instantiated with a call to logging.getLogger() using the name of a module.

  • Passing the __name__ attribute of a module will return a logger for that module.
  • Not passing a name will return the root logger.

Each module logger is a descendant of the root logger. Messages from descendant loggers are propagated upstream through the hierarchy of ancestral loggers. Propagation of messages can be disabled via the logging.Logger.propagate property.

Any logger which has a handler will format the message and output it to a stream or file depending on the type of handler.

logging.StreamHandler¶

Responsible for sending log records to streams such as sys.stdout or sys.stderr. A handler can be added to a logger via logging.Logger.addHandler().

logging.Formatter¶

Responsible for formatting the layout of log records before outputting to the final destination. They determine what information should be logged. A formatter can be set to a handler with logging.Handler.setFormatter().

logging.Filter¶

Provide the ability to filter log records received by a handler. A filter can be added to a handler with logging.Handler.addFilter().
class msTools.core.py.logging_utils.Logger(name, level=0)¶

Bases: logging.Logger

Extends the functionality of the current logger class by inheriting from the result of logging.getLoggerClass().

The resulting class must be set using logging.setLoggerClass() in order for logging.getLogger() to return instances of this class.

makeRecord(*args, **kwargs)¶

Extends the functionality of logging.LogRecord objects produces by instances of this logger.

The following attributes are added to logging.LogRecord objects and can be used to format the layout of the final output.

  • funcNameLineno: Uses format %(funcNameLineno)s. Produces output funcName:lineno.
  • nameFuncNameLineno: Uses format %(nameFuncNameLineno)s. Produces output name - funcName:lineno.
  • levelNameFuncNameLineno: Uses format %(levelNameFuncNameLineno)s. Produces output levelname - funcName:lineno.
timeit(level)¶

Decorator factory for producing a decorator which will time a decorated function and log a record of the result.

Parameters:level (int) – A level constant from logging.Logger representing the level at which to log the timing message. Possible attributes are NOTSET, DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR, CRITICAL

Example

logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)

@logger.timeit(logging.DEBUG)
def foo():
    time.sleep(2)

# Produces a logging output which details the running time of the `foo` call
foo()
class msTools.core.py.logging_utils.NoParsingFilter(filterNamePrefix, *args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: logging.Filter

A logging.Filter subclass used to prevent a handler from processing logging.LogRecord objects from certain loggers.

__init__(filterNamePrefix, *args, **kwargs)¶

Initialise the filter.

Parameters:filterNamePrefix (basestring) – Used to filter logging.LogRecord objects. If the name attribute starts with this prefix, the handler to which this filter is assigned will not process the record.
filter(record)¶

Override of logging.Filter.filter(). Filters based on the initialised prefix.
